  • Field Details

    • rowsAffected

      public static int rowsAffected

  • Constructor Details

    • Order

      public Order(int customerId, int restaurantId, double totalCost, int driverId, boolean finalised)
      The constructor for the Order class. It is not used but has been included for the sake of completeness.
      Parameters:
      customerId - The customer's unique ID number or code. Generated automatically upon registration.
      restaurantId - The restaurant's unique ID number or code. Generated automatically upon registration.
      totalCost - The total cost of all "lines" on a specific order. Calculated from the values in the items_order table.
      driverId - The driver's unique ID number or code. Generated automatically upon registration.
      finalised - A boolean value so that an order can be "signed off" as complete when delivered and paid.

  • Method Details

    • openOrder

      public static int openOrder(Connection connection, String customerFirstName, String customerSurname, String restaurantName) throws SQLException
      This method opens an order and allocates an order number to it. At this stage the order will only have an order number, customer id and restaurant id allocated to it. The rest of the details of the order is still to be populated.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the Customer.findCustomerId and Restaurant.findRestaurantId methods as well as the PreparedStatement.
      customerFirstName - The customer's first name needed to determine the customer id.
      customerSurname - The customer's surname, also needed to determine the customer id.
      restaurantName - The restaurant name needed to determine the restaurant if.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • returnOrderNumber

      public static int returnOrderNumber(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      This method is used to search for an order number. When a customer firstname and surname is used there is a possibility of getting multiple order numbers, therefore the method findExistingOrderNumber is relied on to help with that scenario where the multiple order numbers are stored in an ArrayList and returned to this method for display and user choice.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed for the invocation of findExistingOrderNumber and displayOrder.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main method needed for user input with the help of the utility class UserInput.
      Returns:
      The required order number searched for by customer first and surname and restaurant name.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • addInitialOrderDetails

      public static void addInitialOrderDetails(Connection connection, String restaurantName, int orderNumber) throws SQLException
      This method is called from the captureNewOrder method invoked in the main method of a new order and fills in the driver allocation, updates the driver's workload; it also updates the total cost of the order also generated in the captureNewOrder method. The order has all of its initial details after this method has been invoked.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method which is needed for the invocation of the Driver.driverAllocation and Driver.updateDriverWorkload methods as well as the instances of PreparedStatement.
      restaurantName - The name of the restaurant needed to determine the restaurant ID in order to allocate a driver in that area.
      orderNumber - The order number needed to update with the total cost and allocated driver.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • updateWithNewItems

      public static void updateWithNewItems(Connection connection, int orderNumber) throws SQLException
      A method to update a table with the total cost based on the items_order table that indexes all costs for a specific order. The orders table is then updated with this cost which is the total cost of the order.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the instances of PreparedStatement.
      orderNumber - The order number to gain access to the correct records in both the items_order and orders tables.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • displayOrder

      public static void displayOrder(Connection connection, int orderNumber) throws SQLException
      A method to display the order details in various situations in the program.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main program needed for the instances of PreparedStatement as well as the Customer.findCustomerName, Restaurant.findRestaurantName, Driver.findDriverName, Item .findItemName and Item.findItemPrice methods.
      orderNumber - The order number to use as entry point to all the information that needs to be displayed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • findExistingOrderNumber

      public static ArrayList<Integer> findExistingOrderNumber(Connection connection, Scanner input) throws SQLException
      A method that searches for the order number using the customer's first and surname as well as the restaurant's name to try and eliminate duplicates as far as possible. The order numbers are then stored in an ArrayList which is returned from the method and used in the returnOrderNumber method which is discussed under that methods comment.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main menu needed here for the instances of PreparedStatement.
      input - The Scanner instance from the main menu which is needed to read user input with the help of the UserInput utility class.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of order numbers whether 0 or multiple order numbers.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • checkForIncompleteOrders

      public static ArrayList<Integer> checkForIncompleteOrders(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      This method checks for orders with incomplete information based on null values in the orders table. There is also a similar method that checks for incomplete customer information in the Customer class. The assumption is that the restaurant, menu items and driver information is relatively fixed so, it is not checked everytime.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList with the numbers of the incomplete orders found.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • findPendingOrders

      public static ArrayList<Integer> findPendingOrders(Connection connection) throws SQLException
      A method that finds pending orders by searching through the boolean column finalised in the orders table and returns a list of records that have false values.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the PreparedStatement.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of the order numbers of the pending orders.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • makeFinal

      public static void makeFinal(Connection connection, int orderNumber) throws SQLException
      This method changes the finalised value of a record in the orders table to true when am order is completed. It also updates the allocated driver's workload by invoking Driver .updateDriverWorkload and prints an invoice to file by invoking printInvoice.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method needed here for the instances of PreparedStatement and the two methods Driver .updateDriverWorkload printInvoice
      orderNumber - The order number that is used as the entry point to carry out these functions.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • printInvoice

      public static void printInvoice(Connection connection, int orderNumber) throws SQLException
      This method handles the printing of the invoice in a format determined by the fictional company.
      Parameters:
      connection - The Connection resource from the main method that is used extensively throughout this method both for PreparedStatement and other method invocation which will not be discussed individually.
      orderNumber - The order number of the particular record in the orders table which is the "index" table of the database. All information can be accessed through this order number.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the underlying MySQL service fails.

    • writeInvoiceToFile

      public static void writeInvoiceToFile(String lineToPrint)
      The method by which the invoice is printed to a text file line by line.
      Parameters:
      lineToPrint - The string that is printed to the indicated file.
